   20: -module(tar_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2,
   25:          borderline/1, atomic/1, long_names/1,
   26: 	 create_long_names/1, bad_tar/1, errors/1, extract_from_binary/1,
   27: 	 extract_from_binary_compressed/1, extract_filtered/1,
   28: 	 extract_from_open_file/1, symlinks/1, open_add_close/1, cooked_compressed/1,
   29: 	 memory/1,unicode/1,read_other_implementations/1,bsdtgz/1,
   30:          sparse/1, init/1, leading_slash/1, dotdot/1,
   31:          roundtrip_metadata/1, apply_file_info_opts/1,
   32:          incompatible_options/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   38: 
   39: all() -> 
   40:     [borderline, atomic, long_names, create_long_names,
   41:      bad_tar, errors, extract_from_binary,
   42:      extract_from_binary_compressed, extract_from_open_file,
   43:      extract_filtered,
   44:      symlinks, open_add_close, cooked_compressed, memory, unicode,
   45:      read_other_implementations, bsdtgz,
   46:      sparse,init,leading_slash,dotdot,roundtrip_metadata,
   47:      apply_file_info_opts,incompatible_options].
   48: 
   49: groups() -> 
   50:     [].
   51: 
   52: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   56:     ok.
   57: 
   58: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   65:     Ports = ordsets:from_list(erlang:ports()),
   66:     [{ports,Ports}|Config].
   67: 
   68: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive,
   69: %% multiple times with different file sizes.  Also check that the file
   70: %% attributes of the extracted file has survived.
   71: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72: 
   73:     %% Note: We cannot use absolute paths, because the pathnames will be
   74:     %% too long for the limit allowed in tar files (100 characters).
   75:     %% Therefore, strip off the current working directory from the front
   76:     %% of the private directory path.
   77: 
   78:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
   79:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   80:     TempDir = remove_prefix(Cwd++"/", filename:join(RootDir, "borderline")),
   81:     ok = file:make_dir(TempDir),
   82: 
   83:     Record = 512,
   84:     Block = 20 * Record,
   85: 
   86:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
   87: 		  [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
   88: 		   Block-2*Record-1, Block-2*Record, Block-2*Record+1,
   89: 		   Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
   90: 		   Block-1, Block, Block+1,
   91: 		   Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
   92: 
   93:     %% Clean up.
   94:     delete_files([TempDir]),
   95: 
   96:     verify_ports(Config).
   97: 
   98: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
   99:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  100:     borderline_test(Size, TempDir, true),
  101:     borderline_test(Size, TempDir, false),
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: borderline_test(Size, TempDir, IsUstar) ->
  105:     Prefix = case IsUstar of
  106:                  true ->
  107:                      "file_";
  108:                  false ->
  109:                      lists:duplicate(100, $f) ++ "ile_"
  110:              end,
  111:     SizeList = integer_to_list(Size),
  112:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++ SizeList ++".tar"),
  113:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, Prefix++SizeList),
  114: 
  115:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  116:     RandomBytes = rand:bytes(Size),
  117:     ok = file:write_file(Name, RandomBytes),
  118:     ok = erl_tar:create(Archive, [Name]),
  119:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  120: 
  121:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  122:     IsUstar = is_ustar(Archive),
  123:     {ok, [Name]} = erl_tar:table(Archive),
  124:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  125: 
  126:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  127:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  128:     RandomBytes = Bin,
  129: 
  130:     %% Verify that Unix tar can read it.
  131:     case IsUstar of
  132:         true ->
  133:             tar_tf(Archive, Name);
  134:         false ->
  135:             ok
  136:     end,
  137: 
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: tar_tf(Archive, Name) ->
  141:     case os:type() of
  142: 	{unix, _} ->
  143: 	    tar_tf1(Archive, Name);
  144: 	_ ->
  145: 	    ok
  146:     end.
  147: 
  148: tar_tf1(Archive, Name) ->
  149:     Expect = Name ++ "\n",
  150:     cmd_expect("tar tf " ++ Archive, Expect).
  151: 
  152: %% We can't use os:cmd/1, because Unix 'tar tf Name' on Solaris never
  153: %% terminates when given an archive of a size it doesn't like.
  154: 
  155: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  156:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, eof]),
  157:     get_data(Port, Expect).
  158: 
  159: get_data(Port, Expect) ->
  160:     receive
  161: 	{Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  162: 	    get_data(Port, match_output(Bytes, Expect, Port));
  163: 	{Port, eof} ->
  164: 	    Port ! {self(), close}, 
  165: 	    receive
  166: 		{Port, closed} ->
  167: 		    true
  168: 	    end, 
  169: 	    receive
  170: 		{'EXIT',  Port,  _} -> 
  171: 		    ok
  172: 	    after 1 ->				% force context switch
  173: 		    ok
  174: 	    end, 
  175: 	    match_output(eof, Expect, Port)
  176:     end.
  177: 
  178: match_output([C|Output], [C|Expect], Port) ->
  179:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  180: match_output([_|_], [_|_], Port) ->
  181:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  182: match_output([X|Output], [], Port) ->
  183:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, [X|Output]});
  184: match_output([], Expect, _Port) ->
  185:     Expect;
  186: match_output(eof, [], _Port) ->
  187:     [];
  188: match_output(eof, _Expect, Port) ->
  189:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, unexpected_end_of_input).
  190: 
  191: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  192:     unlink(Port),
  193:     exit(Port, die),
  194:     ct:fail(Reason).
  195: 
  196: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  197:     case os:type() of
  198: 	{win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  199: 	{unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  200:     end.
  201: 
  202: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: create/extract/table, on compressed
  203: %% and uncompressed archives.
  204: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  205: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  206:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  207:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  208:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  209:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  210: 
  211:     %% Create an uncompressed archive.  The compressed flag should still be
  212:     %% allowed when listing contents or extracting.
  213: 
  214:     Tar1 = "uncompressed.tar",
  215:     erl_tar:create(Tar1, Names, []),
  216:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, []),
  217:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, [compressed]),
  218:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, [cooked]),
  219:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, [compressed,cooked]),
  220: 
  221:     %% Create a compressed archive.
  222: 
  223:     Tar2 = "compressed.tar",
  224:     erl_tar:create(Tar2, Names, [compressed]),
  225:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, [compressed]),
  226:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, []),
  227:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, [compressed,cooked]),
  228:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, [cooked]),
  229:     ok = io:format("No compressed option: ~p, ~s",
  230: 		   [Reason, erl_tar:format_error(Reason)]),
  231: 
  232:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  233: 
  234:     Tar3 = "uncompressed_cooked.tar",
  235:     erl_tar:create(Tar3, Names, [cooked]),
  236:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, []),
  237:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, [compressed]),
  238:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, [cooked]),
  239:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, [compressed,cooked]),
  240: 
  241:     Tar4 = "compressed_cooked.tar",
  242:     erl_tar:create(Tar4, Names, [compressed,cooked]),
  243:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, [compressed]),
  244:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, []),
  245:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, [compressed,cooked]),
  246:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, [cooked]),
  247:     ok = io:format("No compressed option: ~p, ~s",
  248: 		   [Reason, erl_tar:format_error(Reason)]),
  249: 
  250:     %% Clean up.
  251:     delete_files([Tar1,Tar2,Tar3,Tar4|Names]),
  252: 
  253:     verify_ports(Config).
  254: 
  255: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  256: 
  257: char_seq(N, First) ->
  258:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  259: 
  260: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  261:     Result;
  262: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  263:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  264: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  265:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  266: 
  267: data_files() ->
  268:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  269: 	     {"small_file", 7, $d},
  270: 	     {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  271: 	     {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  272:     create_files(Files),
  273:     Files.
  274: 
  275: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) ->
  276:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  277:     create_files(Rest);
  278: create_files([]) ->
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: %% Test to extract an Unix tar file containing filenames longer than
  282: %% 100 characters and empty directories.
  283: long_names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  284:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  285:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "long_names.tar"),
  286:     run_in_short_tempdir(Config,
  287: 			 fun() -> do_long_names(Long) end),
  288:     verify_ports(Config).
  289: 
  290: 
  291: do_long_names(Long) ->
  292:     %% Try table/2 and extract/2.
  293:     case erl_tar:table(Long, [verbose]) of
  294: 	{ok,List} when is_list(List) ->
  295: 	    io:format("~p\n", [List])
  296:     end,
  297: 
  298:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  299:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Long),
  300:     Base = filename:join([Cwd, "original_software", "written_by",
  301: 			  "a_bunch_of_hackers",
  302: 			  "spending_all_their_nights",
  303: 			  "still", "not_long_enough",
  304: 			  "but_soon_it_will_be"]),
  305: 
  306:     %% Verify that the empty directory was created.
  307:     EmptyDir = filename:join(Base, "empty_directory"),
  308:     {ok, #file_info{type=directory}} = file:read_file_info(EmptyDir),
  309: 
  310:     %% Verify that the files were created.
  311:     {ok,First} = file:read_file(filename:join(Base, "first_file")),
  312:     {ok,Second} = file:read_file(filename:join(Base, "second_file")),
  313:     "Here"++_ = binary_to_list(First),
  314:     "And"++_ = binary_to_list(Second),
  315: 
  316:     ok.
  317: 
  318: %% Creates a tar file from a deep directory structure (filenames are
  319: %% longer than 100 characters).
  320: create_long_names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     run_in_short_tempdir(Config, fun create_long_names/0),
  322:     verify_ports(Config).
  323: 
  324: create_long_names() ->
  325:     {ok,Dir} = file:get_cwd(),
  326:     Dirs = ["aslfjkshjkhliuf",
  327: 	    "asdhjfehnbfsky",
  328: 	    "sahajfskdfhsz",
  329: 	    "asldfkdlfy4y8rchg",
  330: 	    "f7nafhjgffagkhsfkhsjk",
  331: 	    "dfjasldkfjsdkfjashbv"],
  332: 
  333:     DeepDir = make_dirs(Dirs, []),
  334:     AFile = filename:join(DeepDir, "a_file"),
  335:     Hello = "hello, world\n",
  336:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, Hello),
  337:     TarName = filename:join(Dir,  "my_tar_with_long_names.tar"),
  338:     ok = erl_tar:create(TarName, [AFile]),
  339: 
  340:     %% Print contents.
  341:     ok = erl_tar:tt(TarName),
  342: 
  343:     %% Extract and verify.
  344:     true = is_ustar(TarName),
  345:     ExtractDir = "extract_dir",
  346:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  347:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TarName, [{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  348:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(filename:join(ExtractDir, AFile)),
  349:     Hello = binary_to_list(Bin),
  350: 
  351:     ok.
  352: 
  353: make_dirs([Dir|Rest], []) ->
  354:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  355:     make_dirs(Rest, Dir);
  356: make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  357:     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  358:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  359:     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  360: make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  361:     Dir.
  362: 
  363: %% Try erl_tar:table/2 and erl_tar:extract/2 on some corrupted tar files.
  364: bad_tar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  365:     try_bad("bad_checksum", bad_header, Config),
  366:     try_bad("bad_octal",    invalid_tar_checksum, Config),
  367:     try_bad("bad_too_short",    eof, Config),
  368:     try_bad("bad_even_shorter", eof, Config),
  369:     verify_ports(Config).
  370: 
  371: try_bad(Name0, Reason, Config) ->
  372:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  373: 
  374:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  375:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  376:     Name = Name0 ++ ".tar",
  377:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  378:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  379:     Dest = filename:join(PrivDir, Name0),
  380:     Opts = [verbose, {cwd, Dest}],
  381:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  382:     io:fwrite("Expected: ~p\n", [Expected]),
  383:     case {erl_tar:table(Full, Opts), erl_tar:extract(Full, Opts)} of
  384: 	{Expected, Expected} ->
  385: 	    io:format("Result: ~p", [Expected]),
  386: 	    case catch erl_tar:format_error(Reason) of
  387: 		{'EXIT', CrashReason} ->
  388: 		    ct:fail({format_error, crashed, CrashReason});
  389: 		String when is_list(String) ->
  390: 		    io:format("format_error(~p) -> ~s", [Reason, String]);
  391: 		Other ->
  392: 		    ct:fail({format_error, returned, Other})
  393: 	    end;
  394: 	{Other1, Other2} ->
  395: 	    io:format("table/2 returned ~p", [Other1]),
  396: 	    io:format("extract/2 returned ~p", [Other2]),
  397: 	    ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other1, Other2})
  398:     end.
  399: 
  400: %% Tests that some common errors return correct error codes
  401: %% and that format_error/1 handles them correctly.
  402: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  403:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  404: 
  405:     %% Give the tar file the same name as a directory.
  406:     BadTar = filename:join(PrivDir, "bad_tarfile.tar"),
  407:     ok = file:make_dir(BadTar),
  408:     try_error(erl_tar, create, [BadTar, []], {BadTar, eisdir}),
  409: 
  410:     %% Try including non-existent files in the tar file.
  411:     NonExistent = "non_existent_file",
  412:     GoodTar = filename:join(PrivDir, "a_good_tarfile.tar"),
  413:     try_error(erl_tar, create, [GoodTar, [NonExistent]],
  414: 	      {NonExistent, enoent}),
  415: 
  416:     %% Clean up.
  417:     delete_files([GoodTar,BadTar]),
  418: 
  419:     verify_ports(Config).
  420: 
  421: try_error(M, F, A, Error) ->
  422:     io:format("Trying ~p:~p(~p)", [M, F, A]),
  423:     case catch apply(M, F, A) of
  424: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  425: 	    exit(Reason);
  426: 	ok ->
  427: 	    ct:fail(unexpected_success);
  428: 	{error, Error} ->
  429: 	    case catch erl_tar:format_error(Error) of
  430: 		{'EXIT', FReason} ->
  431: 		    ct:fail({format_error, crashed, FReason});
  432: 		String when is_list(String) ->
  433: 		    io:format("format_error(~p) -> ~s", [Error, String]);
  434: 		Other ->
  435: 		    ct:fail({format_error, returned, Other})
  436: 	    end;
  437: 	Other ->
  438: 	    ct:fail({expected, {error, Error}, actual, Other})
  439:     end.
  440: 
  441: %% remove_prefix(Prefix, List) -> ListWithoutPrefix.
  442: 
  443: remove_prefix([C|Rest1], [C|Rest2]) ->
  444:     remove_prefix(Rest1, Rest2);
  445: remove_prefix(_, Result) ->
  446:     Result.
  447: 
  448: %% Test extracting a tar archive from a binary.
  449: extract_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  451:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  452:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  453:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  454:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  455: 
  456:     %% Read a tar file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  457:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Long),
  458:     ok = erl_tar:extract({binary, Bin}, [{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  459: 
  460:     %% Verify.
  461:     Dir = filename:join(ExtractDir, "no_fancy_stuff"),
  462:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir),
  463:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "a_dir_list")),
  464:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "EPLICENCE")),
  465: 
  466:     %% Clean up.
  467:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  468: 
  469:     verify_ports(Config).
  470: 
  471: extract_from_binary_compressed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  472:     %% Test extracting a compressed tar archive from a binary.
  473:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  474:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  475:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "cooked_tar_problem.tar.gz"),
  476:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary_compressed"),
  477:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  478:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  479: 
  480:     %% Try taking contents.
  481:     {ok,Files} = erl_tar:table({binary,Bin}, [compressed]),
  482:     io:format("~p\n", [Files]),
  483:     19 = length(Files),
  484: 
  485:     %% Try taking contents when already uncompressed.
  486:     {ok,Files} = erl_tar:table({binary,zlib:gunzip(Bin)}, [compressed]),
  487:     io:format("~p\n", [Files]),
  488:     19 = length(Files),
  489: 
  490:     %% Trying extracting from a binary.
  491:     ok = erl_tar:extract({binary,Bin}, [compressed,{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  492:     {ok,List} = file:list_dir(filename:join(ExtractDir, "ddll_SUITE_data")),
  493:     io:format("~p\n", [List]),
  494:     19 = length(List),
  495: 
  496:     %% Clean up while at the same time testing that all file
  497:     %% were extracted as expected.
  498:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
  499: 			  File = filename:join(ExtractDir, N),
  500: 			  io:format("Deleting: ~p\n", [File]),
  501: 			  ok = file:delete(File)
  502: 		  end, Files),
  503: 
  504:     %% Clean up the rest.
  505:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  506: 
  507:     verify_ports(Config).
  508: 
  509: %% Test extracting a tar archive from a binary.
  510: extract_filtered(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  512:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  513:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  514:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  515:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  516: 
  517:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Long, [{cwd,ExtractDir},{files,["no_fancy_stuff/EPLICENCE"]}]),
  518: 
  519:     %% Verify.
  520:     Dir = filename:join(ExtractDir, "no_fancy_stuff"),
  521:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir),
  522:     false = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "a_dir_list")),
  523:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "EPLICENCE")),
  524: 
  525:     %% Clean up.
  526:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  527: 
  528:     verify_ports(Config).
  529: 
  530: %% Test extracting a tar archive from an open file.
  531: extract_from_open_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  532:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  533:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  534:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  535:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_open_file"),
  536:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  537: 
  538:     {ok, File} = file:open(Long, [read]),
  539:     ok = erl_tar:extract({file, File}, [{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  540: 
  541:     %% Verify.
  542:     Dir = filename:join(ExtractDir, "no_fancy_stuff"),
  543:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir),
  544:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "a_dir_list")),
  545:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "EPLICENCE")),
  546: 
  547:     %% Close open file.
  548:     ok = file:close(File),
  549: 
  550:     %% Clean up.
  551:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  552: 
  553:     verify_ports(Config).
  554: 
  555: %% Make sure incompatible options are rejected when opening archives with file
  556: %% descriptors.
  557: incompatible_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  558:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  559:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  560: 
  561:     {ok, File} = file:open(Long, [read]),
  562:     Handle = {file, File},
  563: 
  564:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, compressed}}}
  565:         = erl_tar:open(Handle, [read, compressed]),
  566:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, cooked}}}
  567:         = erl_tar:open(Handle, [read, cooked]),
  568: 
  569:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, compressed}}}
  570:         = erl_tar:extract(Handle, [compressed]),
  571:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, cooked}}}
  572:         = erl_tar:extract(Handle, [cooked]),
  573: 
  574:     ok = file:close(File),
  575: 
  576:     verify_ports(Config).
  577: 
  578: %% Test that archives containing symlinks can be created and extracted.
  579: symlinks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  580:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  581:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "symlinks"),
  582:     VulnerableDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "vulnerable_symlinks"),
  583:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  584:     ok = file:make_dir(VulnerableDir),
  585:     ABadSymlink = filename:join(Dir, "bad_symlink"),
  586:     PointsTo = "a/definitely/non_existing/path",
  587:     Res = case make_symlink("a/definitely/non_existing/path", ABadSymlink) of
  588: 	      {error, enotsup} ->
  589: 		  {skip, "Symbolic links not supported on this platform"};
  590: 	      ok ->
  591: 		  symlinks(Dir, "bad_symlink", PointsTo),
  592: 		  long_symlink(Dir),
  593:                   symlink_vulnerability(VulnerableDir)
  594: 	  end,
  595: 
  596:     %% Clean up.
  597:     delete_files([Dir,VulnerableDir]),
  598:     verify_ports(Config),
  599:     Res.
  600: 
  601: make_symlink(Path, Link) ->
  602:     case os:type() of
  603: 	{win32,_} ->
  604: 	    %% Symlinks on Windows have two problems:
  605: 	    %%   1) file:read_link_info/1 cannot read out the target
  606: 	    %%      of the symlink if the target does not exist.
  607: 	    %%      That is possible (but not easy) to fix in the
  608: 	    %%      efile driver.
  609: 	    %%
  610: 	    %%   2) Symlinks to files and directories are different
  611: 	    %%      creatures. If the target is not existing, the
  612: 	    %%      symlink will be created to be of the file-pointing
  613: 	    %%      type. That can be partially worked around in erl_tar
  614: 	    %%      by creating all symlinks when the end of the tar
  615: 	    %%      file has been reached.
  616: 	    %%
  617: 	    %% But for now, pretend that there are no symlinks on
  618: 	    %% Windows.
  619: 	    {error, enotsup};
  620: 	_ ->
  621: 	    file:make_symlink(Path, Link)
  622:     end.
  623: 
  624: symlinks(Dir, BadSymlink, PointsTo) ->
  625:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, "symlink.tar"),
  626:     DerefTar = filename:join(Dir, "dereference.tar"),
  627: 
  628:     %% Create the archive.
  629: 
  630:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  631:     GoodSymlink = "good_symlink",
  632:     AFile = "a_good_file",
  633:     ALine = "A line of text for a file.",
  634:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, ALine),
  635:     ok = file:make_symlink(AFile, GoodSymlink),
  636:     ok = erl_tar:create(Tar, [BadSymlink, GoodSymlink, AFile], [verbose]),
  637:     true = is_ustar(Tar),
  638: 
  639:     %% List contents of tar file.
  640: 
  641:     ok = erl_tar:tt(Tar),
  642: 
  643:     %% Also create another archive with the dereference flag.
  644: 
  645:     ok = erl_tar:create(DerefTar, [AFile, GoodSymlink], [dereference, verbose]),
  646:     true = is_ustar(DerefTar),
  647: 
  648:     %% Extract files to a new directory.
  649: 
  650:     NewDir = filename:join(Dir, "extracted"),
  651:     ok = file:make_dir(NewDir),
  652:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd, NewDir}, verbose]),
  653: 
  654:     %% Verify that the files are there.
  655: 
  656:     ok = file:set_cwd(NewDir),
  657:     {ok, #file_info{type=symlink}} = file:read_link_info(BadSymlink),
  658:     {ok, PointsTo} = file:read_link(BadSymlink),
  659:     {ok, #file_info{type=symlink}} = file:read_link_info(GoodSymlink),
  660:     {ok, AFile} = file:read_link(GoodSymlink),
  661:     Expected = list_to_binary(ALine),
  662:     {ok, Expected} = file:read_file(GoodSymlink),
  663: 
  664:     %% Extract the "dereferenced archive"  to a new directory.
  665: 
  666:     NewDirDeref = filename:join(Dir, "extracted_deref"),
  667:     ok = file:make_dir(NewDirDeref),
  668:     ok = erl_tar:extract(DerefTar, [{cwd, NewDirDeref}, verbose]),
  669: 
  670:     %% Verify that the files are there.
  671: 
  672:     ok = file:set_cwd(NewDirDeref),
  673:     {ok, #file_info{type=regular}} = file:read_link_info(GoodSymlink),
  674:     {ok, #file_info{type=regular}} = file:read_link_info(AFile),
  675:     {ok, Expected} = file:read_file(GoodSymlink),
  676:     {ok, Expected} = file:read_file(AFile),
  677: 
  678:     ok.
  679: 
  680: long_symlink(Dir) ->
  681:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, "long_symlink.tar"),
  682:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  683: 
  684:     AFile = "long_symlink",
  685:     RequiresPAX = "tmp/aarrghh/this/path/is/far/longer/than/one/hundred/characters/which/is/the/maximum/number/of/characters/allowed",
  686:     ok = file:make_symlink(RequiresPAX, AFile),
  687:     ok = erl_tar:create(Tar, [AFile], [verbose]),
  688:     false = is_ustar(Tar),
  689:     NewDir = filename:join(Dir, "extracted"),
  690:     _ = file:make_dir(NewDir),
  691:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd, NewDir}, verbose]),
  692:     ok = file:set_cwd(NewDir),
  693:     {ok, #file_info{type=symlink}} = file:read_link_info(AFile),
  694:     {ok, RequiresPAX} = file:read_link(AFile),
  695:     ok.
  696: 
  697: symlink_vulnerability(Dir) ->
  698:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  699:     ok = file:make_dir("tar"),
  700:     ok = file:set_cwd("tar"),
  701:     ok = file:make_symlink("..", "link"),
  702:     ok = file:write_file("../file", <<>>),
  703:     ok = erl_tar:create("../my.tar", ["link","link/file"]),
  704:     ok = erl_tar:tt("../my.tar"),
  705: 
  706:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  707:     delete_files(["file","tar"]),
  708:     ok = file:make_dir("tar"),
  709:     ok = file:set_cwd("tar"),
  710:     {error,{"..",unsafe_symlink}} = erl_tar:extract("../my.tar"),
  711: 
  712:     ok.
  713: 
  714: init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  715:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  716:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  717:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "init"),
  718:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  719: 
  720:     [{FileOne,_,_}|_] = oac_files(),
  721:     TarOne = filename:join(Dir, "archive1.tar"),
  722:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(TarOne, [write]),
  723: 
  724:     %% If the arity of the fun is wrong, badarg should be returned
  725:     {error, badarg} = erl_tar:init(Fd, write, fun file_op_bad/1),
  726: 
  727:     %% Otherwise we should be good to go
  728:     {ok, Tar} = erl_tar:init(Fd, write, fun file_op/2),
  729:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, FileOne, []),
  730:     ok = erl_tar:close(Tar),
  731:     {ok, [FileOne]} = erl_tar:table(TarOne),
  732: 
  733:     verify_ports(Config).
  734: 
  735: file_op_bad(_) ->
  736:     throw({error, should_never_be_called}).
  737: 
  738: file_op(write, {Fd, Data}) ->
  739:     file:write(Fd, Data);
  740: file_op(position, {Fd, Pos}) ->
  741:     file:position(Fd, Pos);
  742: file_op(read2, {Fd, Size}) ->
  743:     file:read(Fd, Size);
  744: file_op(close, Fd) ->
  745:     file:close(Fd).
  746: 
  747: open_add_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  748:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  749:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  750:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "open_add_close"),
  751:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  752: 
  753:     [{FileOne,_,_},{FileTwo,_,_},{FileThree,_,_}] = oac_files(),
  754:     ADir = "empty_dir",
  755:     AnotherDir = "another_dir",
  756:     SomeContent = filename:join(AnotherDir, "some_content"),
  757:     ok = file:make_dir(ADir),
  758:     ok = file:make_dir(AnotherDir),
  759:     ok = file:make_dir(SomeContent),
  760: 
  761:     TarOne = filename:join(Dir, "archive1.tar"),
  762:     {ok,AD} = erl_tar:open(TarOne, [write]),
  763:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, FileOne, []),
  764: 
  765:     %% Add with {NameInArchive,Name}
  766:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, {"second file", FileTwo}, []),
  767: 
  768:     %% Add with {binary, Bin}
  769:     {ok,FileThreeBin} = file:read_file(FileThree),
  770:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, {FileThree, FileThreeBin}, [verbose]),
  771: 
  772:     %% Add with Name
  773:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, FileThree, "chunked", [{chunks,11411},verbose]),
  774:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, ADir, [verbose]),
  775:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, AnotherDir, [verbose]),
  776:     ok = erl_tar:close(AD),
  777:     true = is_ustar(TarOne),
  778: 
  779:     ok = erl_tar:t(TarOne),
  780:     ok = erl_tar:tt(TarOne),
  781: 
  782:     Expected = {ok,[FileOne,"second file",FileThree,"chunked",ADir,SomeContent]},
  783:     Expected = erl_tar:table(TarOne),
  784: 
  785:     delete_files(["oac_file","oac_small","oac_big",Dir,AnotherDir,ADir]),
  786: 
  787:     verify_ports(Config).
  788: 
  789: oac_files() ->
  790:     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  791: 	     {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  792: 	     {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  793:     create_files(Files),
  794:     Files.
  795: 
  796: cooked_compressed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  797:     %% Test that a compressed archive can be read in cooked mode.
  798:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  799:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  800:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "cooked_tar_problem.tar.gz"),
  801: 
  802:     %% Try table/2 and extract/2.
  803:     {ok,List} = erl_tar:table(Name, [cooked,compressed]),
  804:     io:format("~p\n", [List]),
  805:     19 = length(List),
  806:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Name, [cooked,compressed,{cwd,PrivDir}]),
  807: 
  808:     %% Clean up while at the same time testing that all file
  809:     %% were extracted as expected.
  810:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
  811: 			  File = filename:join(PrivDir, N),
  812: 			  io:format("Deleting: ~p\n", [File]),
  813: 			  ok = file:delete(File)
  814: 		  end, List),
  815: 
  816:     %% Clean up.
  817:     delete_files([filename:join(PrivDir, "ddll_SUITE_data")]),
  818: 
  819:     verify_ports(Config).
  820: 
  821: %% Test that an archive can be created directly from binaries and
  822: %% that an archive can be extracted into binaries.
  823: memory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  824:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  825: 
  826:     FileBins = [{"bar/fum", <<"BARFUM">>},{"foo", <<"FOO">>}],
  827:     Name1 = filename:join(DataDir, "memory.tar"),
  828:     ok = erl_tar:create(Name1, FileBins, [write,verbose]),
  829:     {ok,Extracted1} = erl_tar:extract(Name1, [memory,verbose]),
  830:     FileBins1 = lists:sort(Extracted1),
  831: 
  832:     io:format("FileBins: ~p\n", [FileBins]),
  833:     io:format("FileBins1: ~p\n", [FileBins1]),
  834:     FileBins = FileBins1,
  835: 
  836:     Name2 = filename:join(DataDir, "memory2.tar"),
  837:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(Name2, [write]),
  838:     [ok,ok] = [erl_tar:add(Fd, B, N, [write,verbose]) || {N,B} <- FileBins],
  839:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
  840:     {ok,Extracted2} = erl_tar:extract(Name2, [memory,verbose]),
  841:     FileBins2 = lists:sort(Extracted2),
  842:     io:format("FileBins2: ~p\n", [FileBins2]),
  843:     FileBins = FileBins2,
  844: 
  845:     %% Clean up.
  846:     ok = delete_files([Name1,Name2]),
  847: 
  848:     verify_ports(Config).
  849: 
  850: read_other_implementations(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  851:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  852:     Files = ["v7.tar", "gnu.tar", "bsd.tar",
  853:              "star.tar", "pax_mtime.tar"],
  854:     do_read_other_implementations(Files, DataDir),
  855:     verify_ports(Config).
  856: 
  857: do_read_other_implementations([], _DataDir) ->
  858:     ok;
  859: do_read_other_implementations([File|Rest], DataDir) ->
  860:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [File]),
  861:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  862:     {ok, _} = erl_tar:table(Full),
  863:     {ok, _} = erl_tar:extract(Full, [memory]),
  864:     do_read_other_implementations(Rest, DataDir).
  865: 
  866: %% test block padding with compressed tar from bsdtar or tape
  867: bsdtgz(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  868:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  869:     File = "example_pad.tgz",
  870:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  871:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [File]),
  872:     Table = ["autofs.conf","rpc"],
  873:     {ok, Table} = erl_tar:table(Full, [compressed]),
  874:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Full),
  875:     {ok, Table} = erl_tar:table({binary, Bin}, [compressed]),
  876:     verify_ports(Config).
  877: 
  878: %% Test handling of sparse files
  879: sparse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  880:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  881:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  882:     Sparse01Empty = "sparse01_empty.tar",
  883:     Sparse01 = "sparse01.tar",
  884:     Sparse10Empty = "sparse10_empty.tar",
  885:     Sparse10 = "sparse10.tar",
  886:     do_sparse([Sparse01Empty, Sparse01, Sparse10Empty, Sparse10], DataDir, PrivDir),
  887:     verify_ports(Config).
  888: 
  889: do_sparse([], _DataDir, _PrivDir) ->
  890:     ok;
  891: do_sparse([Name|Rest], DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  892:     io:format("~nTrying sparse file ~s", [Name]),
  893:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  894:     {ok, [_]} = erl_tar:table(Full),
  895:     {ok, _} = erl_tar:extract(Full, [memory]),
  896:     do_sparse(Rest, DataDir, PrivDir).
  897: 
  898: %% Test filenames with characters outside the US ASCII range.
  899: unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  900:     run_unicode_node(Config, ["+fnu"]),
  901:     case has_transparent_naming() of
  902: 	true ->
  903: 	    run_unicode_node(Config, ["+fnl"]);
  904: 	false ->
  905: 	    ok
  906:     end.
  907: 
  908: run_unicode_node(Config, Args) ->
  909:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  910:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  911:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  912: 		  [fun() -> do_unicode(PrivDir) end,[]]),
  913:     peer:stop(Peer),
  914:     ok.
  915: 
  916: has_transparent_naming() ->
  917:     case os:type() of
  918: 	{unix,darwin} -> false;
  919: 	{unix,_} -> true;
  920: 	_ -> false
  921:     end.
  922: 
  923: do_unicode(PrivDir) ->
  924:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  925:     case file:make_dir("unicöde") of
  926:         ok ->
  927:             Names = lists:sort(unicode_create_files()),
  928:             Tar = "unicöde.tar",
  929:             ok = erl_tar:create(Tar, ["unicöde"], []),
  930: 
  931:             %% Unicode filenames require PAX format.
  932:             false = is_ustar(Tar),
  933:             {ok,Names0} = erl_tar:table(Tar, []),
  934:             Names = lists:sort(Names0),
  935:             _ = [ok = file:delete(Name) || Name <- Names],
  936:             ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar),
  937:             _ = [{ok,_} = file:read_file(Name) || Name <- Names],
  938:             _ = [ok = file:delete(Name) || Name <- Names],
  939:             ok = file:del_dir("unicöde");
  940:         {error,eilseq} ->
  941:             %% The FS (eg zfs) does not support transparent naming
  942:             ok
  943:     end,
  944:     ok.
  945: 
  946: unicode_create_files() ->
  947:     FileA = "unicöde/smörgåsbord",
  948:     ok = file:write_file(FileA, "yum!\n"),
  949:     [FileA|case file:native_name_encoding() of
  950: 	       utf8 ->
  951: 		   FileB = "unicöde/Хороший файл!",
  952: 		   ok = file:write_file(FileB, "But almost empty.\n"),
  953: 		   [FileB];
  954: 	       latin1 ->
  955: 		   []
  956: 	   end].
  957: 
  958: leading_slash(Config) ->
  959:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  960:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  961:     TarFile = filename:join(Dir, "leading_slash.tar"),
  962:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(TarFile),
  963:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(TarFile, [write]),
  964:     TarMemberName = "e/d/c/b/a_member",
  965:     TarMemberNameAbs = "/" ++ TarMemberName,
  966:     Contents = <<"contents\n">>,
  967:     ok = erl_tar:add(Fd, Contents, TarMemberNameAbs, [verbose]),
  968:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
  969: 
  970:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TarFile, [{cwd,Dir}]),
  971: 
  972:     {ok,Contents} = file:read_file(filename:join(Dir, TarMemberName)),
  973:     ok.
  974: 
  975: dotdot(Config) ->
  976:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  977:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  978:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  979:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, "dotdot.tar"),
  980:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(Tar, [write]),
  981:     BeamFile = code:which(?MODULE),
  982:     ok = erl_tar:add(Fd, BeamFile, "a/./../../some_file", []),
  983:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
  984: 
  985:     {error,{_,unsafe_path=Error}} = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd,Dir}]),
  986:     false = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(PrivDir, "some_file")),
  987:     io:format("~s\n", [erl_tar:format_error(Error)]),
  988: 
  989:     ok.
  990: 
  991: roundtrip_metadata(Config) ->
  992:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  993:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  994:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  995: 
  996:     do_roundtrip_metadata(Dir, "name-does-not-matter"),
  997:     ok.
  998: 
  999: do_roundtrip_metadata(Dir, File) ->
 1000:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".tar"),
 1001:     BeamFile = code:which(?MODULE),
 1002:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(Tar, [write]),
 1003:     ok = erl_tar:add(Fd, BeamFile, File, []),
 1004:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
 1005: 
 1006:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd,Dir}]),
 1007: 
 1008:     %% Make sure that size and modification times are the same
 1009:     %% on all platforms.
 1010:     {ok,OrigInfo} = file:read_file_info(BeamFile),
 1011:     ExtractedFile = filename:join(Dir, File),
 1012:     {ok,ExtractedInfo} = file:read_file_info(ExtractedFile),
 1013:     #file_info{size=Size,mtime=Mtime,type=regular} = OrigInfo,
 1014:     #file_info{size=Size,mtime=Mtime,type=regular} = ExtractedInfo,
 1015: 
 1016:     %% On Unix platforms more fields are expected to be the same.
 1017:     case os:type() of
 1018:         {unix,_} ->
 1019:             #file_info{access=Access,mode=Mode} = OrigInfo,
 1020:             #file_info{access=Access,mode=Mode} = ExtractedInfo,
 1021:             ok;
 1022:         _ ->
 1023:             ok
 1024:     end.
 1025: 
 1026: apply_file_info_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1027:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1028: 
 1029:     ok = file:make_dir("empty_directory"),
 1030:     ok = file:write_file("file", "contents"),
 1031: 
 1032:     Opts = [{atime, 0}, {mtime, 0}, {ctime, 0}, {uid, 0}, {gid, 0}],
 1033:     TarFile = "reproducible.tar",
 1034:     {ok, Tar} = erl_tar:open(TarFile, [write]),
 1035:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, "file", Opts),
 1036:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, "empty_directory", Opts),
 1037:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, <<"contents">>, "memory_file", Opts),
 1038:     erl_tar:close(Tar),
 1039: 
 1040:     ok = file:make_dir("extracted"),
 1041:     erl_tar:extract(TarFile, [{cwd, "extracted"}]),
 1042: 
 1043:     {ok, #file_info{mtime=0}} =
 1044:         file:read_file_info("extracted/empty_directory", [{time, posix}]),
 1045:     {ok, #file_info{mtime=0}} =
 1046:         file:read_file_info("extracted/file", [{time, posix}]),
 1047:     {ok, #file_info{mtime=0}} =
 1048:         file:read_file_info("extracted/memory_file", [{time, posix}]),
 1049: 
 1050:     ok.
 1051: 
 1052: %% Delete the given list of files.
 1053: delete_files([]) -> ok;
 1054: delete_files([Item|Rest]) ->
 1055:     case file:delete(Item) of
 1056: 	ok ->
 1057: 	    delete_files(Rest);
 1058: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1059: 	    file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
 1060: 	    delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
 1061: 	    file:del_dir(Item),
 1062: 	    ok;
 1063: 	{error,eacces} ->
 1064: 	    %% We'll see about that!
 1065: 	    file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
 1066: 	    case file:delete(Item) of
 1067: 		ok -> ok;
 1068: 		{error,_} ->
 1069: 		    erlang:yield(),
 1070: 		    file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
 1071: 		    file:delete(Item),
 1072: 		    ok
 1073: 	    end;
 1074: 	{error,_} -> ok
 1075:     end,
 1076:     delete_files(Rest).
 1077: 
 1078: %% Move to a temporary directory with as short name as possible and
 1079: %% execute Fun. Remove the directory and any files in it afterwards.
 1080: %% This is necessary because pathnames on Windows may be limited to
 1081: %% 260 characters.
 1082: run_in_short_tempdir(Config, Fun) ->
 1083:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1084:     PrivDir0 = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1085: 
 1086:     %% Normalize name to make sure that there is no slash at the end.
 1087:     PrivDir = filename:absname(PrivDir0),
 1088: 
 1089:     %% We need a base directory with a much shorter pathname than
 1090:     %% priv_dir. We KNOW that priv_dir is located four levels below
 1091:     %% the directory that common_test puts the ct_run.* directories
 1092:     %% in. That fact is not documented, but a usually reliable source
 1093:     %% assured me that the directory structure is unlikely to change
 1094:     %% in future versions of common_test because of backwards
 1095:     %% compatibility (tools developed by users of common_test depend
 1096:     %% on the current directory layout).
 1097:     Base = lists:foldl(fun(_, D) ->
 1098: 			       filename:dirname(D)
 1099: 		       end, PrivDir, [1,2,3,4]),
 1100: 
 1101:     Dir = make_temp_dir(Base, 0),
 1102:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1103:     io:format("Running test in ~s\n", [Dir]),
 1104:     try
 1105: 	Fun()
 1106:     after
 1107: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1108: 	delete_files([Dir])
 1109:     end.
 1110: 
 1111: make_temp_dir(Base, I) ->
 1112:     Name = filename:join(Base, integer_to_list(I, 36)),
 1113:     case file:make_dir(Name) of
 1114: 	ok -> Name;
 1115: 	{error,eexist} -> make_temp_dir(Base, I+1)
 1116:     end.
 1117: 
 1118: %% Test that the given tar file is a plain USTAR archive,
 1119: %% without any PAX extensions.
 1120: is_ustar(File) ->
 1121:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
 1122:     <<_:257/binary,"ustar",0,_/binary>> = Bin,
 1123:     <<_:156/binary,Type:8,_/binary>> = Bin,
 1124:     case Type of
 1125:         $x -> false;
 1126:         $g -> false;
 1127:         _ -> true
 1128:     end.
 1129: 
 1130: 
 1131: verify_ports(Config) ->
 1132:     PortsBefore = proplists:get_value(ports, Config),
 1133:     PortsAfter = ordsets:from_list(erlang:ports()),
 1134:     case ordsets:subtract(PortsAfter, PortsBefore) of
 1135:         [] ->
 1136:             ok;
 1137:         [_|_]=Rem ->
 1138:             error({leaked_ports,Rem})
 1139:     end.
